summary: Build a modern anime streaming/promo-style website for "Whispers Of The White Moon" with dark cinematic styling, glowing accents, smooth transitions/parallax, content sections (Characters, Episodes, Gallery, News/Updates, Clans), and a secure admin dashboard for the site owner to manage all anime content.
architectural_notes: Visual direction: anime streaming/promo-site feel with dark theme (navy/black/deep purple) and glowing accents (moon blue, fiery gold).
Animation direction: smooth fade transitions; implement parallax scrolling where performant and appropriate (with reduced-motion support).
Update/extend site information architecture to include top-level sections for Characters, Episodes, Gallery, and News/Updates (in addition to Home/Story/Clans) accessible via the top navigation.
Add a secure admin/auth layer and an owner-only admin dashboard for managing site content (episodes, characters, news posts, gallery images, clans), styled consistently with the main dark theme.
Admin dashboard should support role-based access control (RBAC) with permissions by role, including team member account administration.
Homepage should include a dedicated "Series Overview" subsection within the About/Story area, featuring the provided narrative overview text.
Public Episodes UI should conditionally render an embedded video player for episodes marked Released; otherwise show a clear "not released yet" message/state.

Homepage layout: ensure existing sections (Story, Characters, Clans, Episodes, Gallery, News/Updates) can be reordered to match the intended page flow while keeping stable section DOM ids for nav scrolling.
Homepage UX: add clear, prominent section title headings for each main section (Hero/Series title, Story, Characters, Clans, Episodes, Gallery, News) so users see the section name as they scroll.

Hero enhancements: add subtle floating particle layer + parallax background + animated glowing logo on load + fade-in text transitions; include reduced-motion support and keep effects performant. Ambient music must be opt-in with an obvious toggle (muted/off by default) and must not auto-play without user interaction.
known_issues: User reports the Gallery “+” upload button is not visible (likely due to not being authenticated as an admin).
Build/deployment failed due to a configuration error (Caffeine platform error).
Build/generation process intermittently fails with "couldn't generate your application" / "AI couldn't handle that request" errors.
Pro mode: admin cannot edit presentation text after clicking the "Pro" tab (editing UI/flow not working or missing).
Public Gallery is showing the wrong image (fallback/seeded image) instead of the user-uploaded image; user requested it be removed.

existing_features.title: Create a cohesive, modern visual theme for the anime series website that feels cinematic, mysterious, slightly dark but still magical, using glowing accents, clean anime-style typography/layout, and a consistent color system that differentiates the clans (Moon, Sun, Fire, Water, Lightning, Earth, Balance) without using blue/purple as the primary palette unless needed as accents.

Implement the core site structure as a responsive, single-page marketing website with clear sections for: Header navigation, Hero (series title + tagline + primary call-to-action), About/Story overview, Clans (Moon, Sun, Fire, Water, Lightning, Earth, Balance) with power descriptions, and Footer with social/links placeholders.

Add smooth, performant animations that support the cinematic/magical tone: section reveal on scroll, subtle glow pulsing on accents, and interactive hover/focus states for clan cards and primary buttons (with reduced-motion support).

Create reusable UI components for clan presentation (e.g., ClanCard/ClanBadge) that encapsulate clan name, element/power motif, accent color, and description, and render them from a single data source to avoid duplication.
Add required static image assets (generated) to the frontend and integrate them into the layout: a cinematic hero background, and seven minimal glowing clan sigils/icons that match the site’s tone.
Update the global visual theme to use dark navy/black/deep purple backgrounds with glowing moon-blue and fiery-gold accent colors, ensuring the overall look matches an anime streaming/promotion site.
Refine existing animations to emphasize smooth fade transitions across major sections and interactive elements while keeping performance high and respecting reduced-motion preferences.
Add a subtle parallax scrolling effect (if feasible) to the hero background and/or hero overlay layers to enhance cinematic depth, with automatic disablement under reduced-motion.
Update the existing top HeaderNav navigation to include the following sections as clickable items in both desktop and mobile menus: Home, Story, Characters, Clans, Episodes, Gallery, News / Updates.

Add page sections (placeholders are acceptable) corresponding to the new navigation destinations so that HeaderNav scrolling targets exist: Characters, Episodes, Gallery, and News / Updates. Each section must have a stable DOM id that matches the HeaderNav scroll targets.

Update the website name to "Whispers Of The White Moon" everywhere it appears in user-facing UI, including: (1) the browser tab/page title in frontend/index.html, (2) the HeaderNav brand label, (3) the Hero section main heading, and (4) the Footer brand/copyright text.

Replace any remaining hard-coded occurrences of the previous site name (e.g., "Elemental Clans") in the frontend codebase with "Whispers Of The White Moon" to ensure naming consistency across all sections and components.

Replace the current placeholder Characters section (frontend/src/components/sections/CharactersSection.tsx) with a character grid that renders profile cards for exactly these characters: Harusuke (Moon Clan warrior), Kazeyori (Moon Clan), Aurelian (Sun Clan antagonist), Valerion (Season 2 villain, mysterious strategist), Sankei (Fire Clan protagonist), Haruna (Earth Clan protagonist), Mizuki (Water Clan protagonist), Kazei (Wind Clan protagonist), Volt (Lightning Clan protagonist).

Each character card must include: (1) a portrait image placeholder (non-broken, non-empty visual placeholder), (2) clan affiliation, (3) personality description, (4) power summary, and (5) role in story; all user-facing text must be in English.

Implement the Characters section using reusable, data-driven components (e.g., a CharacterCard component and a single characters data source) to avoid duplication and to keep styling consistent with existing clan/section components (glow accents, borders, hover states, and reduced-motion-safe reveal behavior).

Replace the current placeholder Episodes section (frontend/src/components/sections/EpisodesSection.tsx) with a Season 1 episode tracker layout that lists episodes with: episode number, episode title, a short summary, and a release status (e.g., Released / Coming Soon).

Implement the Episodes section using reusable, data-driven components by adding a single Season 1 episodes data source (e.g., frontend/src/data/episodes.ts) and an EpisodeCard (or equivalent) component, avoiding hard-coded repeated markup in the section.

Replace the current placeholder Gallery section (frontend/src/components/sections/GallerySection.tsx) with an image gallery that includes categories for concept art, fight scenes, and character designs, rendered as clickable thumbnails that open a full-view lightbox/modal.

Replace the current placeholder News / Updates section (frontend/src/components/sections/NewsUpdatesSection.tsx) with a News / Dev Log feed that displays posts about animation progress, updates, and announcements, and includes a UI for the creator to publish new posts.

Implement the backend storage and API for News / Dev Log posts in backend/main.mo, and add React Query hooks (frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts or other non-immutable frontend files) to fetch and create posts using the existing actor setup.

Add an admin dashboard UI that is only accessible to authenticated admins and allows the website owner to manage anime content: Episodes, Characters, News / Updates posts, Gallery images, and Clan information.
Implement admin dashboard navigation and access entry points in the existing site UI, including an 'Admin' entry point that is only visible to admin users.

Style the admin dashboard with a modern dark theme that matches the existing website’s cinematic dark styling, using the same design tokens (background/card/border/glow) and component language as the rest of the site.
Add React Query hooks to fetch and mutate Episodes, Characters, Clans, and Gallery items via the backend actor, following the existing hook patterns used for news posts and admin checks.
Build the admin dashboard content management UI with forms and list views for each content type (Episodes, Characters, Clans, Gallery, News) that allow an admin to create, edit, and delete entries.

Update the public-facing marketing site sections (Characters, Episodes, Clans, Gallery, News / Updates) to read their content from backend queries (with sensible loading and error states), so that admin dashboard edits are reflected on the main site.

Update the admin Episodes management UI to allow admins to create and edit an episode with fields: episode title, summary, release status, thumbnail image URL, and video link URL; and ensure delete still works.

Update the admin Gallery management UI (frontend/src/components/admin/panels/GalleryAdminPanel.tsx) to support uploading an image file from the user’s device as an alternative to manually entering an Image URL, while keeping the existing create/edit/delete and category controls (Concept Art, Fight Scenes, Character Designs).

Add client-side validation and user feedback for gallery image uploads in the admin Gallery panel, including allowed file types and a maximum file size, using clear English error messages consistent with existing form error patterns.

Add an admin/owner-only “+” button next to the public Gallery section heading in frontend/src/components/sections/GallerySection.tsx that is only visible when the user is authenticated and is an admin (using the existing useInternetIdentity + useIsCallerAdmin hooks pattern used in HeaderNav).

When the admin/owner clicks the Gallery “+” button, open an upload UI (modal/dialog) that supports both (a) selecting an image file via file picker and (b) drag-and-drop of an image file onto a visible drop area. Use the existing frontend/src/utils/galleryImageUpload.ts validation (PNG/JPEG/WebP, max 5MB) and show clear English validation errors in the UI.

On successful file selection (and optional metadata entry), allow the admin/owner to submit the upload to create a new gallery item using the existing backend mutation hook useCreateGalleryItem (frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts). Ensure the new item appears in the public Gallery grid after creation by invalidating/refetching the existing galleryItems query.

Add the uploaded image file "bestest.png" to the frontend as a static asset and update the static gallery fallback data (frontend/src/data/gallery.ts) so that it contains only one gallery item referencing that asset. Do not include any other gallery images in the static fallback.

Update the public Gallery UI so that it does not show empty/irrelevant category tabs when the gallery contains only the single seeded image; the Gallery view should present the single image cleanly without suggesting multiple categories that have no items.

Extend the admin dashboard UI (frontend) to include a new "Scripts" management area, integrated into the existing admin dashboard layout, allowing authorized users to create, edit, and delete scripts using React Query hooks that call the new backend Scripts APIs.

Add an admin dashboard "Team" (or "Team Members") management area that allows the owner to view team member accounts and manage role-based permissions (grant/change/revoke roles, and any supported activate/deactivate controls). This UI must use React Query hooks wired to the new backend team/role management APIs and show clear English success/error feedback.

Update the Homepage About/Story section (frontend/src/components/sections/AboutSection.tsx, section id="about") to include a clearly labeled "Series Overview" block for "Whispers of the White Moon" using the exact overview text provided by the user. The content must be readable/scannable (support multiple paragraphs/line breaks) and must preserve the existing cinematic styling and reveal-on-scroll / reduced-motion behavior already used in the section.

Update the Balance Clan description in the frontend static clans data source (frontend/src/data/clans.ts) by replacing the existing Balance Clan description with the exact two-paragraph English text provided by the user, preserving the paragraph break (blank line) between paragraphs.

Update the public Episodes section UI (frontend/src/components/sections/EpisodesSection.tsx and related episode components) to allow a visitor to open a video-player view for an episode when that episode’s status is "Released"; if the episode is not released, the UI must clearly tell the visitor that the episode has not been released yet.

Extend the frontend episode view model used by the public Episodes section so it preserves backend episode fields needed for playback (at minimum: videoUrl), and pass those fields through to the episode card/player UI without breaking existing EpisodeCard rendering.

Update the frontend React Query episode hooks and types so the admin UI can read and write episode production progress fields via the backend actor, following the existing useQueries.ts patterns for episodes.

Add an episode production progress tracker UI to the existing Episodes admin panel (frontend/src/components/admin/panels/EpisodesAdminPanel.tsx): show six checkboxes (Writing, Storyboard, Voice Acting, Animation, Editing, Release) for each episode that admins can toggle, and display a progress bar per episode based on the percentage of completed stages (completedStages/6).

Update the public homepage sections so each main section/"slide" displays a prominent, consistent section title matching the HeaderNav labels: Hero shows "Whispers Of The White Moon"; About section shows "Story"; Characters section shows "Characters"; Clans section shows "Clans"; Episodes section shows "Episodes"; Gallery section shows "Gallery"; News section shows "News".
Add an interactive “World Map” experience that visually shows clan territories and important locations, where clicking a location opens lore information in a modal/dialog.

Integrate the World Map into the existing homepage layout without changing the existing HeaderNav links/scroll targets; place it as a sub-section within the existing Clans section or immediately adjacent to it while preserving the current #clans section id and existing layout/animations.

Create a single, data-driven source for map locations (name, coordinates on the image, associated clan/region if applicable, and lore text) and render markers from that data (no repeated hard-coded marker JSX).
Add the user-uploaded world map image to the frontend as a static asset and use it as the rendered map background (do not route it through the backend).

Update the World Map interaction so each location uses a precise custom-shaped clickable hotspot that matches the map’s mountain/territory outlines (traced polygons/paths) instead of the current circular pin marker buttons.

Extend the single data-driven map locations source (frontend/src/data/worldMapLocations.ts) to include the traced custom shape definition for each location, and render hotspots from this data without hard-coded repeated JSX per location.

Update the Episodes React Query hooks and TypeScript types (frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts and generated backend types usage) so the admin UI can read/write the new episode fields: runtimeMinutes, visibility, releaseDate (admin-set), tagged character IDs, and order. Ensure query invalidation continues to refresh the episodes list after mutations.

Enhance the Episodes admin panel UI (frontend/src/components/admin/panels/EpisodesAdminPanel.tsx) to support editing the requested episode fields when creating and editing: (1) thumbnail image upload from device (in addition to existing URL input), (2) release date selector control, (3) runtime field, (4) visibility toggle with Draft/Scheduled/Public, (5) character tagging via multi-select (populated from backend characters list), and (6) keep the episode summary textbox (already present) but ensure it remains a large, usable text area. All user-facing strings must be in English and validation errors must be clear.

Implement drag-and-drop episode reordering in the Episodes admin panel list (frontend/src/components/admin/panels/EpisodesAdminPanel.tsx). Persist the new order to the backend using the episode order/sort field so that after refresh the order remains. If drag-and-drop reordering already exists, do not duplicate it; instead ensure it correctly persists and reloads.

Create React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts (or another non-immutable frontend file) for admin analytics: fetch overall analytics summary, fetch top viewed characters, top viewed episodes, gallery image popularity, recent user activity, and episode engagement stats, using the existing actor setup and query invalidation patterns.

Add a new “Analytics” area to the admin dashboard UI, integrated into the existing AdminDashboardView tab layout, and implement an AnalyticsAdminPanel component that displays: total site visits, ranked lists for most viewed characters/episodes/gallery images, a recent activity feed, and episode engagement stats. All user-facing text must be in English.

Instrument the public marketing site frontend to record analytics events using the new backend tracking APIs: record a site visit; record views/interactions for Characters, Episodes (including watch attempts/plays), and Gallery items. Instrumentation must be lightweight and must not break existing section rendering or reduced-motion behavior.

Update the existing homepage Hero section (frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx) so it clearly delivers the requested animated experience: slow floating particles (moon dust or wind energy), parallax scrolling background, glowing animated logo on initial page load, and fade-in text transitions for hero content.

Add a user-controlled background ambient music toggle to the homepage Hero (frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx) that can start/stop a bundled ambient audio track, with clear English labeling and accessible controls.
Add a generated, transparent-background hero logo image to the frontend static assets and render it in the Hero section as the animated logo element.

Update the homepage Hero section (frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx) to render a generated transparent hero logo image as a prominent animated element on initial page load, while preserving the existing particles, parallax background, and reduced-motion behavior.

Add a user-controlled ambient background music toggle to the homepage Hero section (frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx) that can start/stop a bundled ambient audio track, using clear English labels and accessible controls.
Ensure Hero section text content uses smooth fade-in transitions (title, subtitle, CTA block) that align with the cinematic theme while remaining performant and respecting prefers-reduced-motion.

Add a new admin dashboard tab labeled "Pro" in frontend/src/components/admin/AdminDashboardView.tsx. When the admin clicks the "Pro" tab, immediately navigate the app to a new Pro editing mode on the public main site (without opening a standard admin CRUD panel).

Extend frontend/src/App.tsx routing to support a third view state for Pro mode (in addition to the existing 'main' and 'admin' hash-based routing). In Pro mode, render the normal public site UI (HeaderNav + all sections + Footer) but with a visible Pro editing toolbar that allows the admin to edit presentation text and exit Pro mode.

Implement a Pro presentation editing experience that lets an admin change and add presentation text while viewing the main site. Provide an always-visible Pro toolbar with: (1) an "Add Text Block" action, (2) an "Edit" capability for existing Pro text blocks, and (3) a "Done" action to finish editing.

Persist Pro presentation text so changes survive a page refresh: add backend storage and APIs in backend/main.mo to (1) read the current Pro presentation content publicly and (2) allow admins to update it. Add corresponding React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to fetch and update the Pro presentation content, and wire the Pro editor to use these hooks.

Ensure that when an authenticated admin clicks the "Pro" tab in the Admin Dashboard, the Pro editing mode reliably allows editing text blocks (title + body) directly on the public site view, including being able to change existing blocks and add new ones.
Ensure the Pro mode "Done" action persists the edited Pro presentation blocks to the backend and that the saved content is visible after a page refresh (and also in non-Pro mode when blocks exist).
Update React Query character hooks/types in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to support reading/writing the new character portrait field when creating and editing characters in the admin UI.

Enhance the Characters admin panel (frontend/src/components/admin/panels/CharactersAdminPanel.tsx) to allow admins to upload/select a character portrait image when creating or editing a character, with client-side validation enforcing a 20MB max file size and allowed image types (PNG/JPEG/WebP) using the existing frontend/src/utils/galleryImageUpload.ts validation utility.

Update the public Characters section data mapping (frontend/src/components/sections/CharactersSection.tsx) and character card rendering (frontend/src/components/characters/CharacterCard.tsx) so that if a character portrait image is available from backend data, it is displayed in place of the current placeholder icon; otherwise keep the existing placeholder behavior.

Remove the character portrait image upload capability from the Admin Dashboard Characters management UI so admins no longer see or interact with any portrait upload/preview/clear controls when creating or editing a character.

Add an admin-only “+” button next to the public Characters section heading, matching the Gallery section “+” button pattern (same visibility rules and similar styling), and use it to open a “Create Character” dialog from the public Characters section.

Add the user-uploaded image file "harusukevs aurelian.png" to the frontend as a static asset (do not route it through the backend) and ensure it can be referenced by the Gallery UI via a stable public path (e.g., under frontend/public/assets/).

Update the static Gallery fallback data (frontend/src/data/gallery.ts) to include a new gallery item that references the uploaded image "harusukevs aurelian.png" so that it appears under the public Gallery section when no backend gallery items are available.

Remove the incorrect static fallback/seeded Gallery images so they no longer appear on the public site when no backend Gallery items exist. Specifically, update the static Gallery fallback data in frontend/src/data/gallery.ts to remove the entries referencing '/assets/bestest.png' and '/assets/generated/harusukevs-aurelian.dim_1536x896.png'.

Add an explicit empty-state UI to the public Gallery section so that when there are no backend Gallery items and the static fallback list is empty, the section shows a clear English message instead of an empty grid/lightbox. Implement this in frontend/src/components/sections/GallerySection.tsx without breaking existing loading/error behavior or admin upload controls.

Add a new public-facing page section with stable DOM id "donation" that displays the donation/support content for "Whispers Of The White Moon" using the exact English text provided by the user (including the Cash App handle "$WOTWM"). The section must match the site’s existing cinematic dark styling, include a prominent section title "Donation", and use the existing reveal-on-scroll / reduced-motion-safe animation behavior used in other sections.

Update the site’s primary navigation (HeaderNav) to include a new clickable item labeled "Donation" that smooth-scrolls to the "#donation" section in both desktop and mobile menus, without breaking existing scroll targets.

Insert the new Donation section into the main site page flow in frontend/src/App.tsx so it appears as part of the public homepage content (and also in Pro mode, since Pro mode renders the normal public site UI). Place it in a sensible location near the end of the page (e.g., before the Footer), while preserving existing section order and behavior.

new_feature_requests.summary: Design and build a modern anime series website with cinematic, mysterious (slightly dark but magical) styling and clan-themed sections (Moon, Sun, Fire, Water, Lightning, Earth, Balance), including glowing accents, smooth animations, and a clean anime-style layout.
Adopt a dark theme using navy, black, and deep purple backgrounds with glowing moon-blue and fiery-gold accent colors; overall feel should resemble an anime streaming/promotion site.
Include smooth fade transitions and, if feasible, parallax scrolling effects to enhance the cinematic feel.
Add a top navigation bar with links to: Home, Story, Characters, Clans, Episodes, Gallery, and News/Updates.

Create a Characters section/page with profile cards for Harusuke, Kazeyori, Aurelian, Valerion, Sankei, Haruna, Mizuki, Kazei, and Volt; each card includes a portrait image placeholder, clan affiliation, personality description, power summary, and role in story.
Create an Episodes section/page with an episode tracker layout for Season 1, listing episodes with titles, short summaries, and release status.
Create a Gallery section/page showcasing concept art, fight scenes, and character designs, using clickable thumbnails that expand into a full-view lightbox/modal.
Create a News / Dev Log section/page where the creator can post animation progress, updates, and announcements about new episodes or seasons.
Adjust the site to feel like an official anime promotion site by emphasizing a dramatic hero section with layered backgrounds, glowing UI highlights, and smooth scrolling animations.

Create a secure admin dashboard (modern dark theme matching the main site) that allows the website owner to manage anime content: episodes, characters, news/updates posts, gallery images, and clan information.

Add backend data models and APIs in the existing single Motoko actor to support CRUD management for Episodes, Characters, Clans, and Gallery items, with admin-only write access and public read access for the marketing site.
Extend backend news management to support admin dashboard operations beyond creation (at minimum: delete and edit existing News / Updates posts), enforcing admin-only write access.
Persist admin-managed content in the backend so that Episodes, Characters, Clans, Gallery items, and News posts remain available after canister upgrades.
Add admin dashboard episode management controls (create/edit/update/delete) with episode fields: title, summary, release status, thumbnail image, and video link.
Extend the backend Episode data model and CRUD APIs to support an episode thumbnail image URL, in addition to the existing title, summary/description, release status, and video link.

Ensure episode thumbnail image URL and video link URL changes made in the admin dashboard are persisted across canister upgrades via the existing migration approach (only if needed due to the state schema change).
Add admin Gallery management tool with image upload controls, deletion, and categorization into Concept Art, Fight Scenes, and Character Designs.
Add an admin/owner-only “+” button next to the public Gallery section; clicking it opens an upload UI that supports selecting an image file and drag-and-drop upload.

Provide an admin-assignment mechanism so the owner can grant admin privileges to the account associated with whispersofthemoon1@gmail.com (e.g., via an admin allowlist/registry or admin-management UI), enabling access to admin-only controls like the Gallery “+” button.
Reset the Gallery by deleting all existing gallery items and then add/seed the Gallery with a specified image provided by the user.

Reset the backend Gallery content by deleting all existing gallery items in canister state and seeding exactly one new gallery item that uses the user-uploaded image file "bestest.png" as its imageUrl.
Extend the admin dashboard to include management tools for "Scripts" content (create/edit/delete) in addition to existing content types.
Add admin dashboard tools to manage team member accounts (e.g., create/edit/deactivate users and assign roles/permissions for role-based access control).

Add a new backend content type named "Scripts" with persistent storage and access-controlled CRUD APIs in the existing single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo). Scripts must support create, list, update, and delete operations, and these operations must be protected by role-based permissions (not publicly writable).

Implement backend role-based permissions for team member accounts so the site owner can manage roles/permissions for other principals. Add APIs to: (1) list team members and their roles, (2) grant a role to a principal, (3) revoke/change a role for a principal, and (4) optionally deactivate/reactivate a team member account. Ensure only the owner (or highest-privilege role) can manage team member accounts and roles.
Add a "Series Overview" block to the Homepage (About/Story section) and include the provided overview text for "Whispers of the White Moon".

Update the Balance Clan description text (public Clans section and any related data source) to the new provided two-paragraph description about the Balance Clan’s former power, downfall, and lingering legends.

Ensure the Balance Clan description is also updated for backend-provided clan data so that the public Clans section shows the new text even when clans are loaded from the backend canister (e.g., by patching existing stored clan records whose name is "Balance Clan" during upgrade or initialization without changing the schema).

Add an Episodes video player experience: allow users to watch an episode via an embedded video player when the episode status is RELEASED; if not released, show a clear message that the episode hasn’t been released yet.
Reposition existing homepage sections (Story, Characters, Clans, Episodes, Gallery, News) so they appear in the correct assigned order on the page (layout reorder only, not adding new sections).

Reposition the existing homepage content sections so they appear in this exact vertical order on the main page: Hero, Story (About section), Characters, Clans, Episodes, Gallery, News / Updates, and ensure the existing Header navigation scroll targets still land on the correct section DOM ids (#hero, #about, #characters, #clans, #episodes, #gallery, #news).

Add an episode production progress tracker inside the admin panel: per-episode checkboxes for writing, storyboard, voice acting, animation, editing, and release, plus progress bars showing completion per episode.
Extend the backend Episode data model to persist per-episode production progress for the following stages as booleans: writing, storyboard, voice acting, animation, editing, and release.

Update backend episode create/update APIs to support setting and updating the six production progress fields, and enforce that only admins can mutate these fields (matching existing episode admin checks).

If the backend Episode schema change requires state migration, add a conditional backend state migration that preserves existing episodes and initializes the new production progress fields to false for all existing records.

Add prominent section title text/headings for each main homepage section/"slide": show "Whispers of the White Moon" on initial hero view, then display section titles like "Story", "Characters", "Clans", "Episodes", "Gallery", and "News" as the user scrolls into each section.
Add an interactive world map showing clan territories and important locations; clicking a location opens lore information.
Update the World Map hotspots to use precise custom-shaped click areas (e.g., traced polygons) that match the mountain/territory outlines instead of simple circular markers.

Improve the Episodes admin panel: support thumbnail image upload, release date selection, runtime field, visibility status (Draft/Scheduled/Public), tagging which characters appear per episode, an episode summary text box, and drag-and-drop episode reordering (skip any items already implemented).

Extend the backend Episode data model and Episodes CRUD APIs in backend/main.mo to support the additional admin-managed episode fields: (1) runtime (in minutes), (2) visibility status with exactly these values: Draft, Scheduled, Public, (3) an explicit release date value that can be set by the admin (not auto-generated), (4) a list of character IDs tagged as appearing in the episode, and (5) an explicit sortable order field used for episode reordering. Ensure existing episode fields and production progress fields continue to work.

Add conditional state migration support (only if required by the schema change) so existing stored episodes are preserved after upgrade and the new episode fields are initialized to sensible defaults (e.g., runtime unset/0, visibility=Draft or Public per current behavior, tagged character IDs empty, order derived from existing episode number/id).
Create an admin-only analytics dashboard showing total site visits, most viewed characters, most viewed episodes, gallery image popularity, recent user activity, and episode engagement stats.

Add backend analytics event tracking to the existing single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo) to record: (1) total site visits, (2) character views, (3) episode views, (4) episode watch attempts/plays, and (5) gallery image views. Tracking APIs must be safe for public callers (no admin required to record an event) and must not trap for anonymous visitors.

Add backend admin-only query APIs in backend/main.mo to compute and return aggregated analytics for the admin dashboard: total site visits, most viewed characters, most viewed episodes, gallery image popularity, recent user activity, and episode engagement statistics.

Ensure analytics state is preserved across canister upgrades. If new stable state fields are introduced for analytics in backend/main.mo, add/update backend/migration.mo following the project’s conditional migration policy so existing state is preserved and new analytics fields initialize safely.

Create an animated homepage Hero section with slow floating particles (moon dust/wind energy), parallax scrolling background, a glowing animated logo on initial page load, and fade-in text transitions.
Add a background ambient music toggle on the homepage (user-controlled on/off) for optional hero ambience.
Fix the backend build/deployment failure by correcting the migration module import and usage in backend/main.mo so that the Motoko canister compiles successfully and can be deployed.

Ensure the backend’s migration integration follows the project’s conditional migration policy: only run migration logic when upgrading existing stable state, and do not introduce breaking schema changes without preserving existing state.

Add a new "Pro" tab in the admin dashboard that opens a presentation-style editing mode on the main public site, allowing the admin to change/add text inline; provide a clear "Done" action to exit and return to the admin panel.
